meanings.definition: Engaging in secret or underhanded schemes or plots.
meanings.sent1: The machinating villain planned to steal the treasure without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent2: Her machinating behavior made it hard for others to trust her intentions.
meanings.sent3: The machinating cat tried to sneak into the pantry to steal treats.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky seemed to have a machinating plan to ruin the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The machinating shadows in the alley made the detective suspicious of foul play.

meanings.definition: To plot or scheme in a cunning or devious manner.
meanings.sent1: She was machinating a way to outsmart her opponents in the game.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends spent hours machinating their prank on the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was machinating how to reach the bird feeder hanging high up.
meanings.sent4: The evil queen was machinating her next move to seize power from the king.
meanings.sent5: The spy was machinating a plan to infiltrate the enemy's headquarters undetected.
